text: It didn;t helped

We have been using a home grown CRM so far and are trying to move to HubSpot.

For every contact we have ~160 properties and I want to fetch all of them and update them if required from our existing system.

On HubSpot GUI, I can see the properties as shown in the attachment.
But I am not receiving the not null properties  with the below code
```api_client.crm.contacts.basic_api.get_by_id(contact_id="22901",
                                                              properties=(),
                                                              archived=False)```
I did tried by passing the property names too

Resolved, I was not using the internal name and I have to pass all the properties in an array.
Anyways, I am not receiving all the not null properties as a response without passing the params

I have been trying to retrieve the property Lead Status from contacts API (through OAuth) but it is not included in the response, even when I can see the value in HubSpot. Can someone help me or give me a hint? :sweat_smile: Thanks in advance.

As an example of what I am doing:
```response = client.get("<https://api.hubapi.com/contacts/v1/lists/all/contacts/all>?", params = {"property":"hs_lead_status"})```

Hey Jorge, are you trying to get all Contacts with a specific Lead Status? If so there was recent question in the community very similar to yours:
<https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/APIs-Integrations/How-to-get-all-the-contacts-having-hs-leads-status-Open/m-p/680348>

Hey Chriso, thanks for jump on this :slightly_smiling_face:  I want the property `hs_lead_status` for all my contacts, regardless of the value.  I found this, but it is not solving my point (in fact in the last comment, the response it is not retrieving the lead status either :confused::disappointed:
<https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/APIs-Integrations/HubSpot-API-Get-value-of-quot-hs-lead-status-quot-in-contacts/m-p/240538>
Well it is not working when using `<https://api.hubapi.com/contacts/v1/lists/all/contacts/all>?`  but it is with `<https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v3/objects/contacts>`

thanks for posting your solution here.

are you looking to get all of the properties that a contact can have? you could use the <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/properties|properties api> to be able to get all of them, then build your properties item for your api call
I think if you donâ€™t have it you need to remove it from the object before sending it
normally I would build my form payload by looping through the inputs, then I would add the hutk and ip address if I had them afterwards, making sure they were not null/blank, then convert it to json

Hello, team!
When trying to call the API on the link:
<https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v3/objects/companies?limit=100&associations=deals&associations=contacts&archived=false|https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v3/objects/companies?limit=10&associations=deals&associations=contacts&archived=false>
I don't get company association with other elements (deals, contacts, etc.)
What do you get from this and what are you expecting to get?

I think that the relation is `deal_to_company`  and `contact_to_company` so try:
<https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v3/objects/deals?limit=10&associations=companies>
Not sure if u can get all in one request though
Hello

Before I sent the data to HubSpot.

Do you recommend me to continue with the code or is there a better way to carry out this process?

are you able to print out the response to understand what the api is returning?

Another option is to use HubSpot embeded forms, and not use the contact form 7. Not sure why you are using it, but if you can replicate the items in HubSpot, Iâ€™d like to embedding your forms using a script tag vs using this custom integration.

Hello everyone! I am attempting to use the Timeline events API but for some reason I can't add a timestamp. This is the timestamp I'm trying to use:

```"2022-07-11T14:04:51"```
 If I leave the timestamp out it works fine but when I add one I get the error below. I did notice that the TypeError says "*data*.toISOString". Maybe that should be "date" and its just a bug in the API? Any help would appreciated!

```TypeError: data.toISOString is not a function
     at Function.serialize (C:\Github\Work\slate-HubSpot-integration-app\node_modules\@HubSpot\api-client\lib\codegen\crm\timeline\model\models.js:144:25)   
     at Function.serialize (C:\Github\Work\slate-HubSpot-integration-app\node_modules\@HubSpot\api-client\lib\codegen\crm\timeline\model\models.js:160:69)   
     at Function.serialize (C:\Github\Work\slate-HubSpot-integration-app\node_modules\@HubSpot\api-client\lib\codegen\crm\timeline\model\models.js:139:55)   
     at Function.serialize (C:\Github\Work\slate-HubSpot-integration-app\node_modules\@HubSpot\api-client\lib\codegen\crm\timeline\model\models.js:160:69)   
     at EventsApi.<anonymous> (C:\Github\Work\slate-HubSpot-integration-app\node_modules\@HubSpot\api-client\lib\codegen\crm\timeline\api\eventsApi.js:191:49)
     at Generator.next (<anonymous>)
     at C:\Github\Work\slate-HubSpot-integration-app\node_modules\@HubSpot\api-client\lib\codegen\crm\timeline\api\eventsApi.js:19:71
     at new Promise (<anonymous>)
     at __awaiter (C:\Github\Work\slate-HubSpot-integration-app\node_modules\@HubSpot\api-client\lib\codegen\crm\timeline\api\eventsApi.js:15:12)
     at EventsApi.createBatch (C:\Github\Work\slate-HubSpot-integration-app\node_modules\@HubSpot\api-client\lib\codegen\crm\timeline\api\eventsApi.js:165:16```

Sidenote for anyone who's job it is to care, the documentation for creating a batch of timeline events has the wrong pathway for the main function. The documentation says this:

```const apiResponse = await HubSpotClient.crm.timeline.events.eventsApi.createBatch(BatchInputTimelineEvent);```
But this is what actually works:

```const apiResponse = await HubSpotClient.crm.timeline.eventsApi.createBatch(BatchInputTimelineEvent);```

Hello everyone! I'm currently working with the blog comments api
<https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/comments/post_comments>

Creating comments themselves is not an issue.  However, I want to be able to create nested comment responses from the api (same as if you were using HubSpot's website for viewing the blog posts).  However, I can't seem to figure out how to create nested comments through the api, or if it's even possible.

I've tried passing the parentId (comment id of the comment being responded to).  I then tried passing the entire parent comment as the parent object in the request body but that doesn't seem to work either.  When you pass the parent object, its returned in the response of the comment that was created, however, when you refetch the comments, the parent to the new comment is actually null.  I've also tried passing both the parentId and the parent object but that didn't work either.

Does anyone know if it's possible to create nested comments/comments to comments for blog posts via the api? Or could anyone point me in the right direction/where to go from here?

Any help is greatly appreciated!
Is there any way to listen via webhook for when a note is created?
Would a workflow triggering a webhook call do the trick? <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/workflows/how-do-i-use-webhooks-with-HubSpot-workflows>

Ah, seems like there arenâ€™t workflow enrollment triggers for notes. The Webhook API also only triggers on contact, company and deal events.

You might consider polling the notes `/search` endpoint; weâ€™ve published an explainer: <https://blog.sequin.io/what-to-do-without-HubSpot-webhooks/#homebrewing-events-not-webhooks>

<@UDJMFTHAS> are you working in custom code workflows? That uses version 3.4.1 of the api and is a bit backwards as to what you see on the current docs. To work around this I load up my code editor with a 3.4.1 HubSpot api version and use the hinting in my code editor to figure out the differences.

As far as teh data is going, are you converting it to unix timestamp? sending as a date like 2022.. wonâ€™t work. Also, if it is a date only (not date/time) then it needs to be at utc 0. dates suck to get used to

by looking at that page it appears to only attach to a blog post id. I imagine if you attempt to use the returned comment id for the parent and push that as the blog id, it might be worth trying that, but Iâ€™m going to guess it doesnâ€™t allow nesting.
